original: gana pa ti /

original: sapta ma tram /

translated: Saptamātṛs,

original: yaksha na / r'a ksha sa /
analyzed: yaksha na / r'a ksha sa /
translated: Yakṣas, Rākṣasas,

original: pi sh'a tsa /
analyzed: pi sh'a tsa /
translated: Piśācas,

original: sarb'a n'am / sarb'a n'am /
analyzed: sarb'a n'am / sarb'a n'am /
translated: and all others,

analyzed: sa pa ri w'a r'a na ai dam ba lim kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi /
translated: together with your retinues, I offer this food. Kha kha khāhi khāhi.

original: grihna grihna / m'a ti kra ma tha /
analyzed: grihna grihna / m'a ti kra ma tha /
translated: Gṛhṇa gṛhṇa. Mati kramanthe.

original: bhu nydzu tha /
analyzed: bhu nydzu tha /
translated: Bhuñja bhuñja.

original: pi pa tha /
analyzed: pi pa tha /
translated: Pibatha pibatha.

original: sa ma ya ma nu smar raksha ntu /
analyzed: sa ma ya ma nu smar raksha ntu /
translated: Samaya manupālaka rakṣantu.

original: ma ma sarba siddhi pra yatstshantu sarba by'a dhi sh'intam ku ru h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ma ma sarba siddhi pra yatstshantu sarba by'a dhi sh'intam ku ru h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Mama sarvasiddhiṃ prayacchantu. Sarvavyādhiṃ śāntam kuru hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes bya bas cho ga bzhin du 'thor 'thung byin la me tog dang / bdug pa dang / mar me dang / rol mo la sogs pas mchod la gtor ma gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas cho ga bzhin du 'thor 'thung byin la me tog dang / bdug pa dang / mar me dang / rol mo la sogs pas mchod la gtor ma gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Having made the sprinkling and drinking water offerings in accordance with the rite, one should make offerings with flowers, incense, lamps, music, and so forth, and then give the sacrificial cake.

original: de nas chog gzhan las gsungs pa bzhin du sbyin sreg gis kyang zhi ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa yang bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas chog gzhan las gsungs pa bzhin du sbyin sreg gis kyang zhi ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa yang bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should also accomplish pacification, increase, and so forth, by means of the fire sacrifice, as taught in other rites.

original: zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang mngon spyod kyang 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir srung ba dang / skyob pa dang / sbed par byed par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang mngon spyod kyang 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir srung ba dang / skyob pa dang / sbed par byed par 'gyur ro // zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the accomplishment of pacification, increase, and destruction, [the Bhagavān] declares, “will become a protector, a refuge, and a shelter.”

original: srung ba ni sdig pa dang bar chad kyis mi tshugs par byed pa dang / bsod nams dang dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa mi nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: srung ba ni sdig pa dang bar chad kyis mi tshugs par byed pa dang / bsod nams dang dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa mi nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: A protector is one who prevents harm from misdeeds and obstacles, and who prevents the loss of merit and roots of virtue, and so forth.

original: @277b skyob pa ni 'jig rten 'di dang phyi ma'i 'jigs pa la sogs skyob pa'o //
analyzed: @277b skyob pa ni 'jig rten 'di dang phyi ma'i 'jigs pa la sogs skyob pa'o //
translated: A refuge is one who protects from the fears of this world and the next.

original: sbed par byed pa nam gang dag nyes pa'i yul du 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: sbed par byed pa nam gang dag nyes pa'i yul du 'jug pa'am /
translated: A shelter is one who prevents the entry of faults into the field of experience.

original: lam du 'jug pa'i dus su mi dang mi ma yin pa rnams kyis bltar mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: lam du 'jug pa'i dus su mi dang mi ma yin pa rnams kyis bltar mi snang ba'o //
translated: At the time of entering the path, humans and non-humans do not see.

original: gnas skabs gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang du zhe na /
translated: In what situation?

original: mnyam par gzhag kyang rung zhes gsungs te go sla'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag kyang rung zhes gsungs te go sla'o //
translated: It is easy to understand what is said, “whether in equipoise or not.”

original: dus ji tsam du zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji tsam du zhe na /
translated: For how long?

original: ring ba dang nye ba dag te /
analyzed: ring ba dang nye ba dag te /
translated: Far and near.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir rtag par rgyun mi 'chad par nyin mtshan phyed par zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir rtag par rgyun mi 'chad par nyin mtshan phyed par zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that, it says, “always, uninterruptedly, day and night, for half the time.”

original: rtag par rgyun mi 'chad par yun ring po ste gtan du'o //
analyzed: rtag par rgyun mi 'chad par yun ring po ste gtan du'o //
translated: Always, uninterruptedly, for a long time, forever.

original: nyin mtshan phyed par ni dus nye bar te nyin zhag gcig la'o //
analyzed: nyin mtshan phyed par ni dus nye bar te nyin zhag gcig la'o //
translated: For half the time, day and night, for a short time, in one day.

original: spyod lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: spyod lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the behavior?

original: 'gro yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: 'gro yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: It is easy to understand what is said, “whether walking and so on.”

original: rgyas pa'i las bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyas pa'i las bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the activity of increasing,

original: mdangs dang stobs dang gzi brjid mchog kyang zhes gsungs te go sla'o //
analyzed: mdangs dang stobs dang gzi brjid mchog kyang zhes gsungs te go sla'o //
translated: it says, “the supreme of splendor, strength, and majesty,” which is easy to understand.

original: dbang gi las bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang gi las bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the activity of controlling,🔽it says,

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis kyang phan gdags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis kyang phan gdags pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: And all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas will also assist.

original: chos thams cad la mi 'jigs pa'i dbang thob pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i spobs pa yang dag par sgrub par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mi 'jigs pa'i dbang thob pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i spobs pa yang dag par sgrub par mdzad pa'o //
translated: One attains the power of fearlessness with regard to all dharmas, and one accomplishes fearless eloquence.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: drag po'i las bstan pa'i phyir bgegs dang log par 'dren pa dang / bdud kyi dgra dang / phyir bzlog pa dang / gzhan gyis mi tshugs pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: drag po'i las bstan pa'i phyir bgegs dang log par 'dren pa dang / bdud kyi dgra dang / phyir bzlog pa dang / gzhan gyis mi tshugs pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the fierce rite, it says, “obstructors, misleaders, Mara’s enemies, repellers, and invulnerable.”

original: de la bgegs ni dngos grub kyi bar du gcod pa ste /
analyzed: de la bgegs ni dngos grub kyi bar du gcod pa ste /
translated: An obstructor is an obstacle to spiritual powers.

original: bsam pa la bgegs byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa la bgegs byed pa'o //
translated: It is an obstruction to one’s intentions.

original: log par 'dren pa ni lam phyin ci log par 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: log par 'dren pa ni lam phyin ci log par 'dren pa'o //
translated: A misleader is one who leads one astray on the wrong path.

original: bdud kyi dgra nyid ni de dag ste /
analyzed: bdud kyi dgra nyid ni de dag ste /
translated: Mara’s enemies are just that.

original: bdud kyang de bgegs kyang de yin pas na bdud kyi dgra'o //
analyzed: bdud kyang de bgegs kyang de yin pas na bdud kyi dgra'o //
translated: Since they are both Mara and obstructors, they are Mara’s enemies.

original: de bas na de la mngon spyod kyi las bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na de la mngon spyod kyi las bya bar gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, one should perform the rite of assault against them.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'khor lo bzhi pa'i phan yon la tshig gi rnam grangs bcu dgus bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhi pa'i phan yon la tshig gi rnam grangs bcu dgus bshad pa ste /
translated: The benefits of the fourth cakra are explained with nineteen enumerations of words.

original: bla ma'i man ngag gis dkrugs pa phreng du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i man ngag gis dkrugs pa phreng du byas pa'o //
translated: [This] is mixed with the guru's intimate instructions and strung together.

original: de ltar 'khor lo bzhi pa rnam par bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor lo bzhi pa rnam par bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the fourth cakra in that way,🔽now, in this fifth cakra, there are two topics in the way of practicing the benefits of all the practices of the beginner:🔽the way of practicing and the way of reciting.

original: da ni 'khor lo lnga pa 'di la las dang po pa dang / dbang po thams tshul ji ltar nyams su blang ba'i phan yon ni tshul ji ltar nyams su blang ba la gnyis te /🔽'don pa'i tshul dang / bsam gtan gnyis las bton pas gzugs sku @278a * //
analyzed: da ni 'khor lo lnga pa 'di la las dang po pa dang / dbang po thams tshul ji ltar nyams su blang ba'i phan yon ni tshul ji ltar nyams su blang ba la gnyis te / 'don pa'i tshul dang / bsam gtan gnyis las bton pas gzugs sku @278a * //
translated: The benefits of the way of reciting are the benefits of the two meditative absorptions:🔽the benefit of seeing the form body and the benefit of the explanation of the meditative absorption of the six applications.

original: mthong ba dang / sbyor ba drug las pas ma gtan bstan /🔽des drod bstan /
analyzed: mthong ba dang / sbyor ba drug las pas ma gtan bstan / des drod bstan /
translated: The benefits of the way of practicing are the benefits of the two meditative absorptions:🔽the benefit of the heat of the path of preparation and the benefit of the peak.

original: de la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: de la yang gnyis te /
translated: There are two topics in the benefit of the heat of the path of preparation:

original: nyin mo'i rtags dang mtshan mo'i rtags las /🔽nyin mo'i phyi rtags su bstan /
analyzed: nyin mo'i rtags dang mtshan mo'i rtags las / nyin mo'i phyi rtags su bstan /
translated: the outer sign of heat and the inner sign of heat.🔽The outer sign of heat is explained as the outer sign of heat.

original: mtshan mo nang gi rtags su ston /
analyzed: mtshan mo nang gi rtags su ston /
translated: The inner sign of heat is explained as the inner sign of heat.

original: sprul sku mthong ba la gnyis te /
analyzed: sprul sku mthong ba la gnyis te /
translated: There are two topics in the benefit of the peak:🔽the benefit of seeing the nirmāṇakāya and the benefit of seeing the sambhogakāya.

original: skye ba'i sgrib pa bcu spangs pas mthong ba dang / dbang bcu dang ldan pas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan bgrang bas mi long ba mjug sdud de bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i sgrib pa bcu spangs pas mthong ba dang / dbang bcu dang ldan pas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan bgrang bas mi long ba mjug sdud de bstan pa'o //
translated: The conclusion is taught by the elimination of the ten obscurations to arising and the enumeration of the qualities of the Buddha by possessing the ten powers.

original: de'i rjes la gzhung gi 'jug don bstan te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la gzhung gi 'jug don bstan te /
translated: After that, the meaning of the engagement of the treatise is taught.

original: de la ma 'ongs dus su gzhung 'di 'dzin par lung bstan pa dang / mjug dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo zhing bzod bar gsol ba'o //
analyzed: de la ma 'ongs dus su gzhung 'di 'dzin par lung bstan pa dang / mjug dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo zhing bzod bar gsol ba'o //
translated: Therein, the prophecy of upholding this treatise in the future and the dedication of the root of merit and request for forbearance in the conclusion are taught.

original: da ni 'khor lo lnga pa'i phan yon bshad pa'i phyir /🔽lag na rdo rje 'chang gzhan yang //
analyzed: da ni 'khor lo lnga pa'i phan yon bshad pa'i phyir / lag na rdo rje 'chang gzhan yang //
translated: Now, in order to explain the benefits of the five wheels,🔽it is said, “Subsequently, Vajrapāṇi,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ” and so on.

original: sngar brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: sngar brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The meaning is as previously understood.

original: mtshan gyi gtsug gi nor bu 'di //
analyzed: mtshan gyi gtsug gi nor bu 'di //
translated: This crest jewel of the name

original: zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: is as previously explained.

original: gang zhig nyin gcig bzhin du dus gsum du ma nyams par lan gsum du kha ton du 'don tam /
analyzed: gang zhig nyin gcig bzhin du dus gsum du ma nyams par lan gsum du kha ton du 'don tam /
translated: Whoever recites this three times a day without fail

original: glegs bam du byas pa la klog cing brjod pa la zhes pa ni de la gang zhig ces pa ni rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dbang po tha ma'am las dang po pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: glegs bam du byas pa la klog cing brjod pa la zhes pa ni de la gang zhig ces pa ni rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dbang po tha ma'am las dang po pa zhes pa'o //
translated: As for in a book, reading and reciting refer to the following: therein refers to a son or daughter of good lineage, of dull faculties or a beginner.

original: nyin gcig ces pa ni nyi ma re re bzhin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nyin gcig ces pa ni nyi ma re re bzhin zhes pa'o //
translated: One day means every day.

original: dus gsum ni go sla'o //
analyzed: dus gsum ni go sla'o //
translated: Three times is easy to understand.

original: ma nyams pa ni lhag chad med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma nyams pa ni lhag chad med par gyur pa'o //
translated: Without fail means without omission or addition.

original: lan gsum du zhes pa ni theb gsum du zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lan gsum du zhes pa ni theb gsum du zhes pa'o //
translated: Three times means three times a day.

original: kha ton ni blo la gsal ba khar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: kha ton ni blo la gsal ba khar brjod pa'o //
translated: Recitation means clearly in the mind, verbally expressed.

original: glegs bam ni ti klog pa'o //
analyzed: glegs bam ni ti klog pa'o //
translated: Book means reading.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i gzugs yid la dmigs shing gzugs dang mthun par sems te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa'i gzugs yid la dmigs shing gzugs dang mthun par sems te /
translated: The Blessed One, the form of Mañjuśrījñānasattva, visualizing in the mind, thinking in accordance with the form,

original: de'i gzugs dang mthun par bsam gtan du byed pa zhes pa ni dbang po 'bring po sngar 'khor lo bzhi pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin skyes pa'i rim pa la dmigs nas gzugs su bsgom pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gzugs dang mthun par bsam gtan du byed pa zhes pa ni dbang po 'bring po sngar 'khor lo bzhi pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin skyes pa'i rim pa la dmigs nas gzugs su bsgom pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: thinking in accordance with that form, practicing concentration, refers to the person of medium faculties, as explained in the previous section on the four wheels, visualizing the stages of arising, and meditating on the form.

original: de'i gzugs dang mthun par bsam gtan byed pa ni zhes pa ste de'i gzugs ni de'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de'i gzugs dang mthun par bsam gtan byed pa ni zhes pa ste de'i gzugs ni de'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The phrase contemplation in accordance with its form means that form is its essence.

original: 'dir la la dag ye shes sems dpa'i sku la dmigs nas kha ton dang / glegs ba ma klog cing 'don pa'o zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: 'dir la la dag ye shes sems dpa'i sku la dmigs nas kha ton dang / glegs ba ma klog cing 'don pa'o zhes 'chad do //
translated: Here, some explain that it is recitation and reading of the scriptures while focusing on the body of the wisdom being.

original: de ltar ni sngar yang gzugs dang mthun par dmigs te zhes zlos pa'i skyon du 'gyur @278b ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni sngar yang gzugs dang mthun par dmigs te zhes zlos pa'i skyon du 'gyur @278b ro //
translated: But this would be a fault, since it would repeat the earlier phrase contemplation in accordance with its form.

original: de rang bzhin dang mthun pa ni ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de rang bzhin dang mthun pa ni ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is meant by in accordance with its nature?

original: de'i rang bzhin ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang rtogs par mdzad par 'gyur pa dang / rtogs par mdzad pa dang / rtogs par mdzad par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang rtogs par mdzad par 'gyur pa dang / rtogs par mdzad pa dang / rtogs par mdzad par gyur to //
translated: Its nature is that all buddhas have realized it, are realizing it, and will realize it.

original: de bas na de'i ngo bo nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i ngo bo nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub bla na med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, its essence is the unsurpassed enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: tshul gang las byung zhe na /
analyzed: tshul gang las byung zhe na /
translated: From what method does it arise?

original: bla na med pa rdo rje'i theg pa las byung ba'i sku'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: bla na med pa rdo rje'i theg pa las byung ba'i sku'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It arises from the unsurpassed Vajra Vehicle, and is the essence of the body.

original: de'i sgrub pa'i yan lag ni sbyor ba dang po dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog la sogs pa bzhi dang / rnal 'byor bzhi dang / bsnyen sgrub bzhi dang / rnal 'byor gyi yan lag drug la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub pa'i yan lag ni sbyor ba dang po dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog la sogs pa bzhi dang / rnal 'byor bzhi dang / bsnyen sgrub bzhi dang / rnal 'byor gyi yan lag drug la sogs pa'o //
translated: The branches of its practice are the first application, the four such as the supreme royal maṇḍala, the four yogas, the four of approach and accomplishment, the six branches of yoga, and so on.

original: de las byung ba'i ye shes sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid yi ge med pa'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i ye shes sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid yi ge med pa'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: The reality of the syllable-less is the nature of the gnosis being that arises from that.

original: 'on kyang de kho na nyid la snying rje rgyun chad nas gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de kho na nyid la snying rje rgyun chad nas gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: However, reality is not abiding with the stream of compassion cut off.

original: sangs rgyas kyi che ba'i yon tan ni rigs gsum pa dang / lnga dang rigs drug dang brgyad la sogs pa yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi che ba'i yon tan ni rigs gsum pa dang / lnga dang rigs drug dang brgyad la sogs pa yang 'byung ngo //
translated: The great qualities of the Buddha also arise as the three families, the five families, the six families, the eight families, and so on.

original: de bas na sku de'i ngo bo nyid ni stong pa chen po dang theg le chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sku de'i ngo bo nyid ni stong pa chen po dang theg le chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of that body is called the great emptiness and the great bindu.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid yin pas rnam pa yang rang bzhin med pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid yin pas rnam pa yang rang bzhin med pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is emptiness endowed with the most sublime of manifestations, the manifestation is the manifestation of the absence of intrinsic existence.

original: de ni las kyi phyag rgya'am phyag rgya chen po'am /
analyzed: de ni las kyi phyag rgya'am phyag rgya chen po'am /
translated: That is the action seal, the great seal,

original: ye shes kyi phyag rgya'am /
analyzed: ye shes kyi phyag rgya'am /
translated: the wisdom seal,🔽or the action seal and wisdom seal.

original: las kyi phyag rgya dang ye shes la brten pa yang phyag rgya sbyang ba ni bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya dang ye shes la brten pa yang phyag rgya sbyang ba ni bsnyen pa'o //
translated: The purification of the seal is the approach.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni nye bar bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni nye bar bsnyen pa'o //
translated: The meditative stabilization is the close approach.

original: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le can gyi gnas skabs ni sgrub pa chen po'o //
analyzed: bcu drug phyed phyed thig le can gyi gnas skabs ni sgrub pa chen po'o //
translated: The state of the one possessing the drop of the half and half of the sixteenth is the great achievement.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor bzhi la sogs pa bsam gtan gyi yan lag bzhi bzhir gsungs pa kun rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor bzhi la sogs pa bsam gtan gyi yan lag bzhi bzhir gsungs pa kun rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, all the statements of four branches of meditative stabilization, such as the four yogas, should be understood.

original: phyag rgya chen po ni stong pa dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas bsnyen pa la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin pas yan lag med cing rtsis las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni stong pa dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas bsnyen pa la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin pas yan lag med cing rtsis las 'das pa'o //
translated: The great seal is the nature of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion, and therefore it is only to be achieved by the approach and so forth. It is without branches and beyond calculation.

original: de lta bas na de'i ngo bo nyid dang mthun par bsam gtan byed pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i ngo bo nyid dang mthun par bsam gtan byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, meditative stabilization is done in accordance with its nature.

original: sbyor ba'i yan lag drug las bsam gtan zhes pa ni yan lag gcig gsal bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i yan lag drug las bsam gtan zhes pa ni yan lag gcig gsal bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: From among the six limbs of union, the Blessed One clearly taught one limb, concentration.

original: don gyis na yan lag drug go bar bya'o //
analyzed: don gyis na yan lag drug go bar bya'o //
translated: In fact, one should understand that there are six limbs.🔽As it is said:🔽Withdrawal, concentration,🔽vital energy control, retention,

original: de yang / so sor sdud dang bsam gtan dang // srog dang rtsol ba 'dzin pa dang // rjes su dran dang ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: de yang / so sor sdud dang bsam gtan dang // srog dang rtsol ba 'dzin pa dang // rjes su dran dang ting nge 'dzin //
translated: recollection, and meditative stabilization

original: spyor ba'i yan lag drug @279a * //
analyzed: spyor ba'i yan lag drug @279a * //
translated: are asserted to be the six limbs of union.

analyzed: tu 'dod // ces gsungs te bla ma'i man ngag las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand them from the instructions of the guru.

analyzed: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba'o //

analyzed: de la rtog pa ni phyi nang du thams cad la 'dzin par byed pa'o //

original: dpyod pa ni de'i ngo bo nges par byas shing de'i rang bzhin khong du chud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa ni de'i ngo bo nges par byas shing de'i rang bzhin khong du chud par byed pa'o //
translated: Discernment is the ascertainment of its nature and the comprehension of its essence.

analyzed: dga' ba ni stong pa nyid kyi sku mthong bas de nyid la zhen pa dang bcas shing sems mi 'gyur par gnas pa'o //
translated: Joy is the seeing of the body of emptiness, and the mind remains there with attachment, without changing.

original: bde ba ni sku dang lhan cig sems 'dres nas ro mnyam pa gsal ba'i bdag nyid can gyis mi g-yo bar 'gyur ro //🔽gdul ba'i dbang gi phyir ring por mi thogs par sprul pa'i de nyid kyi gzugs kyi lus mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /

translated: Bliss is the mixing of the mind with the body, and the mind becomes unmoving through the nature of clarity that is of one taste.🔽For the sake of those to be tamed, the body of the Tathagata, which is the emanation of the body of great compassion, will be seen without delay.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gyi don du tshogs bsags shing smon lam btab pa'i dbang gis snying rje chen po'i skus gdul bya la sku bstan pa ni gdul bya'i dbang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gyi don du tshogs bsags shing smon lam btab pa'i dbang gis snying rje chen po'i skus gdul bya la sku bstan pa ni gdul bya'i dbang gi phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of those to be tamed, the body of the Tathagata, which is the emanation of the body of great compassion, will be seen without delay.

original: ring por mi thogs par zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba dag pas na'o //
analyzed: ring por mi thogs par zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba dag pas na'o //
translated: Without delay means that through the purity of the practice of concentration,

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: it is said:

original: bsam gtan sbyor ba dag pa yis //
analyzed: bsam gtan sbyor ba dag pa yis //
translated: Through the purity of the practice of concentration,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga po ni //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga po ni //
translated: the five superknowledges🔽are attained in this very life.

original: thob par 'gyur ro kye mi bdag / ces gsungs so //
analyzed: thob par 'gyur ro kye mi bdag / ces gsungs so //
translated: O lord of men, you will attain it.

original: bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba ni sngon du dbang bskur ba thob cing tshogs bsags pa dang / lha bsgom pa dang / bzlas brjod bya ba la sogs pa byas pa can gyi rnal 'byor pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa sgom zhing lus bsrang ba dang / mig gi lta stangs dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba ni sngon du dbang bskur ba thob cing tshogs bsags pa dang / lha bsgom pa dang / bzlas brjod bya ba la sogs pa byas pa can gyi rnal 'byor pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa sgom zhing lus bsrang ba dang / mig gi lta stangs dang /
translated: The preparation for meditative concentration is as follows: A yogin who has previously obtained initiation, accumulated the collections, and practiced meditation on the deity, mantra repetition, and so forth, meditates on the stage of completion, straightens the body, and fixes the gaze of the eyes.

original: srog dang rtsol ba bsdams pa dang / byang chub kyi sems 'dzin pa la sogs pa bla ma'i man ngag bzhin sgom pa ni sbyor ba dag pa'o //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba bsdams pa dang / byang chub kyi sems 'dzin pa la sogs pa bla ma'i man ngag bzhin sgom pa ni sbyor ba dag pa'o //
translated: He meditates according to the guru's instructions on the control of the life-force and the exertion, the retention of the bodhicitta, and so forth. This is the pure preparation.

original: de la rang byung ba'i rtags du zhe na /
analyzed: de la rang byung ba'i rtags du zhe na /
translated: What are the signs of self-arising?

original: phyi rtags dang nang rtags gnyis las phyi'i rtags la yang nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyi rtags dang / mchan mo'i rnal 'byor gyi rtags so //
analyzed: phyi rtags dang nang rtags gnyis las phyi'i rtags la yang nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyi rtags dang / mchan mo'i rnal 'byor gyi rtags so //
translated: There are two signs, outer and inner. The outer signs are the signs of the yoga of the daytime and the signs of the yoga of the night.

original: de la nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyi rtags zla ba shar ba lta bu dang / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor lta bu dang / me long lta bu dang / 'ja' lta bu dang / thig le lta bu dang / 'od zer lnga skra'i rtse mo'i tshad tsam du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de la nyin mo'i rnal 'byor gyi rtags zla ba shar ba lta bu dang / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor lta bu dang / me long lta bu dang / 'ja' lta bu dang / thig le lta bu dang / 'od zer lnga skra'i rtse mo'i tshad tsam du mthong ba'o //
translated: The signs of the yoga of the daytime are: seeing the moon arise, a sun mandala, a mirror, a rainbow, a drop, and five-colored light rays the size of a hair tip.

original: mtshan mo yang du blta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / nam mkha' ltar gsal ba lta bu dang / mar me lta bu @279b dang / sbrin  med pa'i nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo yang du blta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / nam mkha' ltar gsal ba lta bu dang / mar me lta bu @279b dang / sbrin  med pa'i nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: The signs of the yoga of the nighttime are: seeing smoke, a mirage, a clear sky, a lamp, and a cloudless sky.

original: de la du ba lta bu ni dang po rnal 'byor pa yid ches par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de la du ba lta bu ni dang po rnal 'byor pa yid ches par byed pa yin la /
translated: Among those, seeing smoke is the first, which causes the yogi to have confidence.

original: lhag ma bcu po ni phyi nas bstan par byed pa'i sbyor ba yang dag par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma bcu po ni phyi nas bstan par byed pa'i sbyor ba yang dag par byed pa yin no //
translated: The remaining ten are the later practices that cause the teaching to be correct.

original: de rnams kyang rnal 'byor gyi sems gsal ba rang bzhin med pa mi rtog pa bsgoms pa'i stobs las byung ba yin gyi mtshan ma dang bcas pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyang rnal 'byor gyi sems gsal ba rang bzhin med pa mi rtog pa bsgoms pa'i stobs las byung ba yin gyi mtshan ma dang bcas pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Those also arise from the power of meditating on the clear, essenceless, nonconceptual mind of yoga, and not from the apprehended and apprehender that arise from having signs.

original: nad rtags ni lte ba'i 'og tu don dam byang chub kyi sems kha dog nag mo skra'i tshad tsam sor gcig pa'am /🔽ba thag rgyas pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: nad rtags ni lte ba'i 'og tu don dam byang chub kyi sems kha dog nag mo skra'i tshad tsam sor gcig pa'am / ba thag rgyas pa lta bu'am /
translated: The sign of illness is seeing a black ultimate bodhicitta, the size of a hair, one finger in length, below the navel.🔽It is like an extended spider web

original: dar dkar gyi skud pa brkyang pa lta bu mthong ba'o ;
analyzed: dar dkar gyi skud pa brkyang pa lta bu mthong ba'o ;
translated: or like an extended thread of white silk.

original: / de skad du yang /🔽ji srid thig le'i nang du yang //
analyzed: / de skad du yang / ji srid thig le'i nang du yang //
translated: Also, it is said:🔽As long as a black line,🔽the size of a hair tip,

original: ri mo nag po skra rtse'i tshad //🔽dri ma med pa'i 'od 'phro ba //
analyzed: ri mo nag po skra rtse'i tshad // dri ma med pa'i 'od 'phro ba //
translated: is seen in the bindu,

original: dus kyi cha ni mthong ba yin //
analyzed: dus kyi cha ni mthong ba yin //
translated: the time factor is seen.

original: de mthong 'od gsal go 'phang ni //
analyzed: de mthong 'od gsal go 'phang ni //
translated: When that is seen, the stage of clear light

original: rnal 'byor pa yis mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: will be seen by the yogi.

original: 'di ni lus ngag yid gsum dri ma med pa las byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni lus ngag yid gsum dri ma med pa las byung ba yin gyi /
translated: This arises from the stainless body, voice, and mind.

original: lus ngag dri ma dang bcas pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus ngag dri ma dang bcas pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: Not from a body and speech that are impure.

original: de ltar bsam gtan sbyor ba dag pa'i rtags byung nas mngon par shes pa lnga'am drug mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar bsam gtan sbyor ba dag pa'i rtags byung nas mngon par shes pa lnga'am drug mthong ba ste /
translated: Thus, once the signs of the purity of the application of meditative concentration have arisen, the five or six superknowledges are seen.

original: de la yang lha'i spyan dang / sha'i spyan dang / shes rab dang / chos kyi dang / ye shes kyi spyan no //
analyzed: de la yang lha'i spyan dang / sha'i spyan dang / shes rab dang / chos kyi dang / ye shes kyi spyan no //
translated: Among them, there is the divine eye, the fleshly eye, the eye of wisdom, the eye of Dharma, and the eye of gnosis.

original: de nyid kyis sprul pa'i lam mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni //
analyzed: de nyid kyis sprul pa'i lam mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni //
translated: By that very [application], the path of emanation is seen.

original: de nyid kyis zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa de nyid kyis tshe 'di la'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa de nyid kyis tshe 'di la'o //
translated: By that very [application] means by that very yogin in this life.

original: sprul pa ni gcig tu ma nges so //
analyzed: sprul pa ni gcig tu ma nges so //
translated: Emanation is not limited to one thing.

original: gzugs ni sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: Form is various.

original: lus ni mig gi yul du byas pa de nyid do //
analyzed: lus ni mig gi yul du byas pa de nyid do //
translated: The body is made into the object of the eye.

original: ci gzugs sna tshogs pa de yang byol song la sogs pa'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci gzugs sna tshogs pa de yang byol song la sogs pa'am zhe na /
translated: Is that various form also of animals and so forth?

analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gzugs kyi sku rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to have various forms of the form bodies of all buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de la sangs rgyas ni mtshan dang dpe byad kyis spras so //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas ni mtshan dang dpe byad kyis spras so //
translated: The Buddha is adorned with the major and minor marks.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de'i 'khor gyis bskor ba'i nam mkha'i snying po la sogs pa kun no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de'i 'khor gyis bskor ba'i nam mkha'i snying po la sogs pa kun no //
translated: The bodhisattvas are all the bodhisattvas surrounding him, such as Ākāśagarbha.

original: gzugs kyi sku rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa zhes pa ni sku mdog dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa zhes pa ni sku mdog dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Having various forms” refers to the colors of the body, the hand implements, and so on.

original: de ltar mthong ba yin gyi thos pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba yin gyi thos pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Is this seeing or hearing?”

original: nam mkha'i dkyil na bzhugs pa dag mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil na bzhugs pa dag mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: “One will see them dwelling in the middle of the sky.”

original: nam mkha' ni bar snang ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni bar snang ngo //
translated: The sky is the space between the earth and the clouds.

original: @280a * // dkyil zhes pa ni dbyings na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: @280a * // dkyil zhes pa ni dbyings na zhes pa'o //
translated: “Middle” means “in the realm.”

analyzed: de na bzhugs nas byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos rnams la chos gsungs pa'i sgra yang lha'i rna bas thos par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Having dwelt there, the sound of the Dharma that is taught to the bodhisattvas and śrāvakas will be heard with the divine ear.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor bas gzugs su snang ba thos pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor bas gzugs su snang ba thos pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: Thus, the form that is seen by the practitioner is the nirmāṇakāya.

original: sgrar thos pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: sgrar thos pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: Hearing as sound is the Enjoyment Body.

original: sems kyis thos pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: sems kyis thos pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Hearing as mind is the Reality Body.

original: gal te de ltar mthong zhing thos pa de yang phyi rol gyi don du mthong zheng thos nas bla ma'i gdams ngag gis ma zin pas shes bya'i sgrib par 'gyur ro //🔽de yang / chu nyid lta bur ba snang ba //
analyzed: gal te de ltar mthong zhing thos pa de yang phyi rol gyi don du mthong zheng thos nas bla ma'i gdams ngag gis ma zin pas shes bya'i sgrib par 'gyur ro // de yang / chu nyid lta bur ba snang ba //
translated: If one sees and hears in that way, but sees and hears as external objects, then it becomes an obscuration to knowledge, because one is not sustained by the guru's instructions.🔽And it is said:🔽Like water itself, it is seen as various colors,

original: dri ma med pa sna tshogs mdog / rnam pa kun te rang gi sems //
analyzed: dri ma med pa sna tshogs mdog / rnam pa kun te rang gi sems //
translated: in all aspects, as one's own mind.

original: gzhan gyi sems min rang gi sems //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems min rang gi sems //
translated: It is not the mind of another, it is one's own mind.

original: rang gi sems yin bde ba nyid //
analyzed: rang gi sems yin bde ba nyid //
translated: One's own mind is bliss.

original: gzhan gyi sems yin bde ba min //🔽yul dang rnam par bral ba yi //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems yin bde ba min // yul dang rnam par bral ba yi //
translated: The mind of another is not bliss.

original: rang bde yid kyis nyams myong ba //🔽gzhan gyi sems bde med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang bde yid kyis nyams myong ba // gzhan gyi sems bde med pa'i phyir //
translated: The experience of one's own bliss,🔽free from objects and aspects,🔽is not taught as bliss,

original: bde ba bstan du mi btub po //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bde ba bstan du mi btub po //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: because it is not the bliss of the mind of another.

original: de bas na 'dir dang po rang gi sems kyi snang ba 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral bas /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir dang po rang gi sems kyi snang ba 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral bas /
translated: Therefore, here, first, the vision of one’s own mind is the eye of the Tathāgata, free from the obscurations of knowables.

original: dpag tshad stong mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde las kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: dpag tshad stong mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde las kyang gsungs so //
translated: It is also stated in the sūtras: “One will see a thousand leagues.”

original: de bas na sha'i spyan dang / lha'i dang / sangs rgyas kyi dang / shes rab dang / ye shes kyi spyan rnams kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bas na sha'i spyan dang / lha'i dang / sangs rgyas kyi dang / shes rab dang / ye shes kyi spyan rnams kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, the eyes of flesh, of gods, of buddhas, of wisdom, and of gnosis are as follows:

original: rnal 'byor pas sems aa wa dh'u t'ir btsud cing bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas sems aa wa dh'u t'ir btsud cing bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The yogin, by the power of inserting and meditating on the mind in the avadhūti, will give rise to the eyes of flesh, of gods, of buddhas, of wisdom, and of gnosis.

original: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pas ma gzigs pa'am mi mkhyen pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pas ma gzigs pa'am mi mkhyen pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is not the slightest thing that is not seen or known by the omniscient one.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor pas srog gi rlung dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya bdun cu rtsa lnga aa ba dh'u t'i'i dbu mar btsud nas sna bug g-yas g-yon nas ni rgyu na phyag rgya chen po bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis dbugs stong phrag brgyad brgya rnal 'byor pa
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor pas srog gi rlung dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya bdun cu rtsa lnga aa ba dh'u t'i'i dbu mar btsud nas sna bug g-yas g-yon nas ni rgyu na phyag rgya chen po bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis dbugs stong phrag brgyad brgya rnal 'byor pa
translated: Thus, the yogi/nī, having inserted the life-force vāyu, twenty-one thousand six hundred and seventy-five times, into the central nāḍī of the avadhūti, when the vāyu moves through the right and left nostrils, through the power of meditating on mahāmudrā, the yogi/nī

original: la 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: stops eight hundred sets of one thousand breaths.

original: de ltar 'gags na ni sa dang po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'gags na ni sa dang po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is stopped in that way, the first stage is attained.

original: de'i ye shes dang 'bras bu ni sha'i spyan rnam par dag pa thob ste /
analyzed: de'i ye shes dang 'bras bu ni sha'i spyan rnam par dag pa thob ste /
translated: The result of that gnosis is the attainment of the pure flesh eye.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gcig mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gcig mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One sees one world system of the ten directions.

original: 'pho ba gnyis pa 'gags pas sa gnyis pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'pho ba gnyis pa 'gags pas sa gnyis pa 'thob ste /
translated: The second movement is stopped and the second stage is attained.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi @280b khams gnyis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi @280b khams gnyis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, one sees two world systems.

original: 'pho ba gsum pa 'gags pas sa gsum 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'pho ba gsum pa 'gags pas sa gsum 'thob ste /
translated: The third movement is stopped and the third stage is attained.

original: lha'i spyan gyis mi las 'das pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gsum mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i spyan gyis mi las 'das pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gsum mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: With the divine eye, one sees three world systems that are beyond humans.

analyzed: 'pho ba bzhi pas sa bzhi 'thob ste phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyis khams brgya tshun chad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the fourth transference, one obtains the fourth stage and sees up to a hundred world systems in the ten directions.
