analyzed: 'pho ba lnga pas ni sa lnga 'thob ste sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams bcu drug mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the fifth transference, one obtains the fifth stage and sees up to sixteen world systems in the ten directions with the eye of a buddha.

original: 'pho ba drug pas srog gi rlung khri brgyad brgya sum cu rtsa phyed dang brgyad 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'pho ba drug pas srog gi rlung khri brgyad brgya sum cu rtsa phyed dang brgyad 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the sixth transference, one stops eighteen thousand, five hundred and fifty life-sustaining winds.

original: sa drug pa 'thob la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams sum cu rtsa gnyis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa drug pa 'thob la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams sum cu rtsa gnyis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One obtains the sixth stage and sees up to thirty-two world systems in the ten directions.

original: 'pho ba bdun pa srog gi rlung dgog pas ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams drug cu rtsa bzhi'i mtha' tshun chod mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'pho ba bdun pa srog gi rlung dgog pas ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams drug cu rtsa bzhi'i mtha' tshun chod mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the seventh transference, one stops the life-sustaining winds and sees up to sixty-four world systems in the ten directions.

original: 'pho ba brgyad pas srog gi rlung khri brgyad brgya sum cu rtsa phyed dang brgyad 'gags pas sa brgyad 'thob las brgyad pa'i mngon par shes pas ni shes rab kyi spyan rnam par dag pas ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa 'thob la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams
analyzed: 'pho ba brgyad pas srog gi rlung khri brgyad brgya sum cu rtsa phyed dang brgyad 'gags pas sa brgyad 'thob las brgyad pa'i mngon par shes pas ni shes rab kyi spyan rnam par dag pas ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa 'thob la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams
translated: By the eighth transference, the life-force vāyu ceases at eighteen thousand, three hundred and fifty-eight, and the eighth bhūmi is attained.🔽The clairvoyance of the eighth bhūmi is the pure eye of wisdom. The stage of nonregression is attained, and one can see the extent of the world systems of the ten directions

original: brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi mtha' tshun tshad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi mtha' tshun tshad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: up to two hundred and eighty.🔽“

original: 'pho ba dgu pa'i srog gi rlung rgyu ba 'gags pas sa dgu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'pho ba dgu pa'i srog gi rlung rgyu ba 'gags pas sa dgu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the ninth transference, the movement of the life-force vāyu ceases, and the ninth bhūmi is attained.

original: mngon par shes pa shes rab kyi spyan thob par 'gyur pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa drug gi mtha' tshul chad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa shes rab kyi spyan thob par 'gyur pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nyis brgya lnga bcu rtsa drug gi mtha' tshul chad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The clairvoyance of the eye of wisdom is attained, and one can see the extent of the world systems of the ten directions up to two hundred and fifty-six.”

original: 'pho ba bcu pas srog gi rlung 'gags pas sa bcu thob pa la mngon par shes pa ni ye shes kyi spyan rnam par dag pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams lnga brgya rtsa gnyis kyi mtha' chun chad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'pho ba bcu pas srog gi rlung 'gags pas sa bcu thob pa la mngon par shes pa ni ye shes kyi spyan rnam par dag pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams lnga brgya rtsa gnyis kyi mtha' chun chad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the tenth transference, the life-force vāyu ceases, and the ten stages are attained. The superknowledge is that through the pure eye of gnosis, one sees the ends of the five hundred and two world systems of the ten directions.

original: 'pho ba bcu gcig pas srog gi rlung 'gags par gyur pas ni sa bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyis sgrib pa gsum spangs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'pho ba bcu gcig pas srog gi rlung 'gags par gyur pas ni sa bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyis sgrib pa gsum spangs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the eleventh transference, the life-force vāyu ceases, and the eleventh stage, the attainment of buddhahood, is attained.

original: mngon par shes pa las ye shes kyi spyan lnga thob pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams stong phrag gcig dang nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i mtha' tshun chad mthong bar 'gyur zhe'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa las ye shes kyi spyan lnga thob pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams stong phrag gcig dang nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i mtha' tshun chad mthong bar 'gyur zhe'o //
translated: The superknowledge is that through the attainment of the five eyes of gnosis, one sees the ends of the one thousand two hundred and forty world systems of the ten directions.

original: 'pho ba bcu gnyis pas srog gi rlung rgyu ba nyi khri chig stong drug brgya bdun cu rtsa lnga gtsug tor gyi 'khor lor 'gags na ni sa bcu @281a * //
analyzed: 'pho ba bcu gnyis pas srog gi rlung rgyu ba nyi khri chig stong drug brgya bdun cu rtsa lnga gtsug tor gyi 'khor lor 'gags na ni sa bcu @281a * //
translated: By the twelfth transference, the movement of the life-force vāyu ceases in the uṣṇīṣa cakra.

original: gnyis pa tshe 'di nyid kho na la rnyed de /
analyzed: gnyis pa tshe 'di nyid kho na la rnyed de /
translated: Second, one obtains this very life.

original: rdo rje 'chang gis thob pas stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi khams gangga'i klung gi bye ma snyed grangs med pa dang /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gis thob pas stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / gzhan yang 'jig rten gyi khams gangga'i klung gi bye ma snyed grangs med pa dang /
translated: Since one obtains Vajradhara, one sees with the eye of pristine consciousness the intermediate world systems of a billion worlds, the trichiliocosm, and also the world systems of the sand of the Ganges river, which are innumerable,

original: dpag tu med pa dang / brjod kyis mi lang ba rnams ye shes kyi spyan ldas mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa dang / brjod kyis mi lang ba rnams ye shes kyi spyan ldas mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: incalculable, and inexpressible.

original: 'dir dbang bcu gcig gis sa ji lta thob pa dang / 'og sgo bde ba 'phel ba las sa ji ltar thob pa ni gzhung spros pas 'jigs pas ma bris so //
analyzed: 'dir dbang bcu gcig gis sa ji lta thob pa dang / 'og sgo bde ba 'phel ba las sa ji ltar thob pa ni gzhung spros pas 'jigs pas ma bris so //
translated: Here, since the text is extensive, I will not write about how the stage is obtained by the eleven empowerments and how the stage is obtained from the increase of bliss in the lower door.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa de la ji skad ces bya /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa de la ji skad ces bya /
translated: What is the name of the yogin who sees in that way?

original: des ji ltar 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: des ji ltar 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: What happens by that?

original: sems can chen po de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can chen po de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The great being, etc.

original: sems can yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na sems can chen po ste /
analyzed: sems can yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na sems can chen po ste /
translated: He is a great being because he is a being and great.

original: sems can rnams kyi nang na klu chen po dang 'dra bas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi nang na klu chen po dang 'dra bas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He is called that because he is like a great naga among beings.

original: nam yang ji ltar gyur kyang zhes pa ni skye ba la dbang thob pas thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nam yang ji ltar gyur kyang zhes pa ni skye ba la dbang thob pas thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du zhes pa'o //
translated: In any way at all means in every way, in all aspects, because he has attained mastery over birth.

original: ji ltar gyur kyang zhes pa ni sprul pa'i sku gzugs kyi lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rigs de dang der skyes kyang 'gro ba kun bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gyur kyang zhes pa ni sprul pa'i sku gzugs kyi lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rigs de dang der skyes kyang 'gro ba kun bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: In any way at all means that even though he is born in the various realms of gods, humans, etc., in the form of an emanation body, he is not like all beings in having suffering, etc.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: rigs ngan kla klo yin na yang //🔽yul de yongs su brtags pa yin //
analyzed: rigs ngan kla klo yin na yang // yul de yongs su brtags pa yin //
translated: Even if he is a low-caste barbarian,🔽that country is to be considered

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: as a holy land.

original: da ni skye ba'i sgrib par gyur pa bcu dang bral bar ston te /
analyzed: da ni skye ba'i sgrib par gyur pa bcu dang bral bar ston te /
translated: Now, he shows that he is free from the ten obscurations to birth.

original: de yang 'dzin pa'i yan lag gi skabs kyi gdams ngag las byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rdo rje nor bu nas phat la sogs pas gzung zhing bzlog pas tshangs par spyod pa la skyon med pas ngan 'gro ngan song du ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes
analyzed: de yang 'dzin pa'i yan lag gi skabs kyi gdams ngag las byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rdo rje nor bu nas phat la sogs pas gzung zhing bzlog pas tshangs par spyod pa la skyon med pas ngan 'gro ngan song du ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes
translated: Moreover, in the section on the branch of retention, the instruction is that the bindu of bodhicitta is held and reversed from the vajra jewel with phaṭ and so on. Since there is no fault in pure conduct, one will not fall to the lower realms.

original: pa'o // de la sems can dmyal ba dang yi dags dang byol song ni ngan 'gro dang ngan song ste /
analyzed: pa'o // de la sems can dmyal ba dang yi dags dang byol song ni ngan 'gro dang ngan song ste /
translated: Therein, the hells, ghosts, and animals are the lower realms and the lower destinies.

original: 'gro ba drug las 'di gsum ngan par 'gro ba yin pa dang / skye ba'i gnas ngan pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug las 'di gsum ngan par 'gro ba yin pa dang / skye ba'i gnas ngan pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Among the six kinds of beings, these three are the lower destinies, and because they are lower places of birth, they are called that.

original: ltung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'og na yod pas de skad ces bya ste skye ba'i sgrib pa dang po'o //
analyzed: ltung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'og na yod pas de skad ces bya ste skye ba'i sgrib pa dang po'o //
translated: “One will not fall” is called that because they are below.

original: rigs ngan du skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni //
analyzed: rigs ngan du skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni //
translated: “One will not be born in an inferior class” is

original: @281b mtho ris na rigs kyi skye ba'i sgrib pa ni mi 'gyur pa la yod pa ste /
analyzed: @281b mtho ris na rigs kyi skye ba'i sgrib pa ni mi 'gyur pa la yod pa ste /
translated: in the higher realms, the obscuration to birth in a class is not being born in an inferior class.

original: shan pa dang / nya ba dang / smyig ma mkhan dang / ko lpags mkhan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shan pa dang / nya ba dang / smyig ma mkhan dang / ko lpags mkhan la sogs pa'o //
translated: butchers, fishermen, hunters, thieves, executioners, guards, and so on.

original: de bas na de ni skye ba'i sgrib pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ni skye ba'i sgrib pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the second obscuration to birth.

original: yul mtha' 'khob tu skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni gang na sangs rgyas kyi chos med pa'i yul te /
analyzed: yul mtha' 'khob tu skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni gang na sangs rgyas kyi chos med pa'i yul te /
translated: One will not be born in a border region, in a place where the Buddha's teachings do not exist.

original: de ni gnas kyi skye ba'i sgrib pa ste gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gnas kyi skye ba'i sgrib pa ste gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third obscuration to birth, the obscuration to place.

original: dbang po ma tshang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po ma tshang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not be born with incomplete faculties.

original: dbang po nyams par skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa 'am /
analyzed: dbang po nyams par skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa 'am /
translated: One will not be born with impaired faculties, as a blind person, a deaf person, and so on,

original: za ma dang ma ning du gyur pa ste de ni rten nyams pa'i skye ba'i sgrib pa ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: za ma dang ma ning du gyur pa ste de ni rten nyams pa'i skye ba'i sgrib pa ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: or as a eunuch or a neuter. This is the fourth obscuration to birth, the obscuration to the basis.

original: log par lta ba dang lha ba ngan pa'i rigs su skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa ni //
analyzed: log par lta ba dang lha ba ngan pa'i rigs su skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa ni //
translated: One will not be born in a family with wrong views or bad views.

original: mi rtag pa la rtag par lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag par lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Wrong views are views such as the belief in permanence with regard to the impermanent.

original: lta ba ngan pa ni chad pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa ni chad pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: Bad views are nihilistic views.

original: rigs ni lta ba phyin ci log par 'dzin pa'i bram ze'i rigs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs ni lta ba phyin ci log par 'dzin pa'i bram ze'i rigs la sogs pa ste /
translated: The caste is that of the Brahmins and so on who hold wrong views.

original: de ni lta ba nyams pa'i skye ba'i sgrib pa ste lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de ni lta ba nyams pa'i skye ba'i sgrib pa ste lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth obscuration to birth, the obscuration of the degeneration of views.

original: sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams na chos med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams na chos med pa'o //
translated: One will not be born in a buddhafield where a buddha is not present. This means that in a buddhafield where a Bhagavat Buddha has passed into Nirvana, the Dharma is absent.

original: de ni zhing yang ma dag pa dang / sangs rgyas mthong ba'i skal ba med pa'i skye ba'i sgrib pa ste drug pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhing yang ma dag pa dang / sangs rgyas mthong ba'i skal ba med pa'i skye ba'i sgrib pa ste drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth obscuration to birth, the obscuration of an impure field and the lack of good fortune to see a Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas bzhugs na yang des bstan pa'i chos sbod ba dang bkol bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni brgya lam na zhes pa shugs la rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bzhugs na yang des bstan pa'i chos sbod ba dang bkol bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni brgya lam na zhes pa shugs la rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: Even when a Buddha is present, one will not hear or practice the Dharma that he teaches. This means that one will only find the Dharma by chance.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang phrad kyang chos la ma dad pa'i dbang gis nyan par mi 'dod pa ni spong ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang phrad kyang chos la ma dad pa'i dbang gis nyan par mi 'dod pa ni spong ba'o //
translated: Even when one encounters the appearance of a Buddha, one does not wish to listen to the Dharma because of a lack of faith in the Dharma. This is the obscuration to abandoning.

original: rang bzhin dang gnas la sogs pas bskal nas chos thos pa'i skal ba med pa ni bkol ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang gnas la sogs pas bskal nas chos thos pa'i skal ba med pa ni bkol ba'o //
translated: Those who are deprived of the opportunity to hear the Dharma because they are in a natural or temporary state of deprivation are called “deprived.”

original: de ni ma dad pa dang bkol ba skye ba'i sgrib pa ste bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ma dad pa dang bkol ba skye ba'i sgrib pa ste bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh obscuration, the obscuration to lack of faith and to being deprived.

original: lha tshe ring po rnams kyi nang du yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni 'du shes med pa'i lha'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: lha tshe ring po rnams kyi nang du yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni 'du shes med pa'i lha'i bye brag ste /
translated: “I will not be born among the gods of long life” refers to the gods of the base of infinite space.

original: yun ring por byang chub la bgegs byed pa ste /
analyzed: yun ring por byang chub la bgegs byed pa ste /
translated: For a long time, they are an obstacle to enlightenment.

original: de ni chos kyi yun gyi sgrib pa ste brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni chos kyi yun gyi sgrib pa ste brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth obscuration, the obscuration to the duration of the Dharma.

original: mu ge dang nad dang mtshon gyi bar gyi bskal pa'i nang du skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni //
analyzed: mu ge dang nad dang mtshon gyi bar gyi bskal pa'i nang du skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni //
translated: “I will not be born during an eon of famine, disease, or war” refers to the eons of famine, disease, and war.

original: mar 'grib pa'i mthar mu ge'i bskal pa dang / nad kyi bskal pa dang / @282a * //🔽mtshon gyi bskal pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: mar 'grib pa'i mthar mu ge'i bskal pa dang / nad kyi bskal pa dang / @282a * // mtshon gyi bskal pa 'byung ste /
translated: At the end of the decrease, there is an eon of famine, an eon of disease, and an eon of war.

original: de ni bskal pa dus kyi skye ba'i sgrib pa ste dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bskal pa dus kyi skye ba'i sgrib pa ste dgu pa'o //
translated: This is the ninth obscuration, the obscuration to being born during an eon of time.

original: snyigs ma lnga'i dus su yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni tshe'i snyigs ma dang / sems can gyi snyigs ma dang / lta ba'i snyigs ma dang / bskal ba'i snyigs ma dang / yo byad kyi snyigs ma ste /
analyzed: snyigs ma lnga'i dus su yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni tshe'i snyigs ma dang / sems can gyi snyigs ma dang / lta ba'i snyigs ma dang / bskal ba'i snyigs ma dang / yo byad kyi snyigs ma ste /
translated: The five degenerations are the degeneration of life, the degeneration of sentient beings, the degeneration of view, the degeneration of the kalpa, and the degeneration of emotions.

original: de'i dus na bskal pa ngan pa gsum po'i dus su skye ba ni snyigs ma'i dus kyi skye pa'i sgrib pa ste bcu pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dus na bskal pa ngan pa gsum po'i dus su skye ba ni snyigs ma'i dus kyi skye pa'i sgrib pa ste bcu pa'o //
translated: Birth in the time of the three bad kalpas in that time is the tenth obscuration, the obscuration of birth in the time of degeneration.

original: skye ba'i sgrib pa de rnams dang bral ba ni rang dbang yod pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i sgrib pa de rnams dang bral ba ni rang dbang yod pa ste /
translated: Being free from those obscurations of birth is having independence.

original: rnal 'byor pa de gal te sems can gyi don mthong na gdul bya'i dbang gis zhes pa snga ma dang don sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de gal te sems can gyi don mthong na gdul bya'i dbang gis zhes pa snga ma dang don sbyar ro //
translated: If that yogin sees the benefit for sentient beings, he is able to go to the bad migrations through the power of his vow, as stated above.

original: nyon mongs pa la dbang ba'i phyir rgyal po dang / dgra dang / tshom rkun gyi 'jigs pa yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la dbang ba'i phyir rgyal po dang / dgra dang / tshom rkun gyi 'jigs pa yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because he has power over the emotions, the fears of kings, enemies, and robbers do not arise.

original: rgyal po'i chad pa dang / dgras srog 'phrog pa dang / nor 'phrog pa dang / chom rkun pas 'jab bus 'phrog pa dang / stobs kyis nor 'phrog pa dang / 'joms pa ste 'jigs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rgyal po'i chad pa dang / dgras srog 'phrog pa dang / nor 'phrog pa dang / chom rkun pas 'jab bus 'phrog pa dang / stobs kyis nor 'phrog pa dang / 'joms pa ste 'jigs pa gsum mo //
translated: The three fears are: the king's punishment, the taking of life by enemies, the taking of wealth by thieves, robbers, and the powerful.

original: ci nas kyang dman pa dang / dbul po'i 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges par zhen pa ste rnal 'byor pa 'jig rten gyi ro zhes pa ni nges par zhen pa ste rnal 'byor pa 'jig rten gyi chos la sogs pa la zhen pa'o //
analyzed: ci nas kyang dman pa dang / dbul po'i 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni nges par zhen pa ste rnal 'byor pa 'jig rten gyi ro zhes pa ni nges par zhen pa ste rnal 'byor pa 'jig rten gyi chos la sogs pa la zhen pa'o //
translated: The phrase so that the fear of being lowly and poor will not arise refers to the attachment of the yogi to worldly things, etc.

original: dman pa ni kha zhan pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa ni kha zhan pa'o //
translated: Lowly means having little wealth.

original: dbul ba ni nor dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dbul ba ni nor dang bral ba'o //
translated: Poor means being without wealth.

original: de bas na 'jigs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'jigs pa lnga'o //
translated: Therefore, there are five fears.

original: dri ngas pa dang / skur pa dang / smad pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / gtam ngan gyi 'jigs pa yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dri ngas pa dang / skur pa dang / smad pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / gtam ngan gyi 'jigs pa yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase so that the fear of being blamed, slandered, disparaged, criticized, and having a bad reputation will not arise refers to

original: dri ngas pa ni gzhan gyis byas pa'i skyon bdag la bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: dri ngas pa ni gzhan gyis byas pa'i skyon bdag la bsgo ba'o //
translated: being blamed means having one's faults proclaimed by others.

original: skur ba zhes pa ni gzhan dad pa med par bya ba'i phyir bdag la yon tan med par sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: skur ba zhes pa ni gzhan dad pa med par bya ba'i phyir bdag la yon tan med par sgrogs pa'o //
translated: Slander is the proclamation of one's own lack of virtue in order to cause others to lose faith.

original: mi snyan pa ni snyan par 'os pa ma yin pa'i tshig brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mi snyan pa ni snyan par 'os pa ma yin pa'i tshig brjod pa'o //
translated: Disparagement is the expression of words that are not worthy of being heard.

original: gtam ngan ni grags pa ma yin pa gleng ba'o //
analyzed: gtam ngan ni grags pa ma yin pa gleng ba'o //
translated: Bad reputation is the discussion of what is not renowned.

original: smad pa ni mtshang 'bru ba'i gleng gzhi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: smad pa ni mtshang 'bru ba'i gleng gzhi brjod pa'o //
translated: Blame is the expression of the basis of a criticism.

original: de ltar 'jigs pa rnam pa bcu ni nyon mongs pa la dbang pa'i phyir mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jigs pa rnam pa bcu ni nyon mongs pa la dbang pa'i phyir mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: Thus, these ten fears do not arise because of mastery over the afflictions.🔽Now, in order to demonstrate mastery over resolute intent, it says, one becomes endowed with a good lineage, clan, and family.

original: da ni lhag par mos pa la dbang pa'i phyir rgyud dang rus dang / rigs bzang po dang yang dag par ldan par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni rgyud dang rus dang rigs ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: da ni lhag par mos pa la dbang pa'i phyir rgyud dang rus dang / rigs bzang po dang yang dag par ldan par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni rgyud dang rus dang rigs ni rnam grangs so //
translated: Lineage, clan, and family are synonyms.

original: zad po ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zad po ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Good means the kṣatriya class and so forth.

original: de ltar @282b rigs mos pa'i yul dang por bstan pa'i phyir kun nas mdzes pa dang / gzugs dang / kha dog dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar @282b rigs mos pa'i yul dang por bstan pa'i phyir kun nas mdzes pa dang / gzugs dang / kha dog dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that resolute intent is the object of the first stage, it says, one also becomes completely beautiful, with form and complexion.

original: kun nas mdzes pa ni lus tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas mdzes pa ni lus tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The all-around beauty is due to the body's being of the right size.

original: gzugs dang kha dog ni sku chu zheng gab pa dang / mdog gser btso ma lta bu'i mos pa'i yul gsungs so //🔽mos par byed pa gang yin pa dang / yul gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs dang kha dog ni sku chu zheng gab pa dang / mdog gser btso ma lta bu'i mos pa'i yul gsungs so // mos par byed pa gang yin pa dang / yul gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The form and color are the body's being covered with the right proportions and the color of refined gold. These are said to be the objects of the aspiration.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams la sdug pa dang yid du 'ong ba dang 'grogs na bde ba dang / mthong na dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams la sdug pa dang yid du 'ong ba dang 'grogs na bde ba dang / mthong na dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to show the aspiration and the object, he says: He is dear to the world, pleasing, delightful to behold.

original: 'jig rten pa ni 'gro ba chu rol mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni 'gro ba chu rol mthong ba'o //
translated: The world is the people who see him from a distance.

original: sdug pa ni gang gis mthong na lhag par brtse ba'o //
analyzed: sdug pa ni gang gis mthong na lhag par brtse ba'o //
translated: The dear is the one who, when seen, is especially loved.

original: yid du 'ong ba ni 'gro ba'i yid 'phrog par byed pa'o //🔽'grogs na bde ba ni yang dang lhan cig tu gnas na sems dbugs phyin pa'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba ni 'gro ba'i yid 'phrog par byed pa'o // 'grogs na bde ba ni yang dang lhan cig tu gnas na sems dbugs phyin pa'o //
translated: The pleasing is the one who captivates the minds of people.🔽 The delightful to behold is the one who, when he appears in the visual field, brings happiness.

original: mthong na dga' ba ni gang gi mig lam du snang na bde ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: mthong na dga' ba ni gang gi mig lam du snang na bde ba thob pa'o //
translated: The delightful to behold is the one who, when he appears in the visual field, brings happiness.

original: de ltar mos pa'i yul bdun no //
analyzed: de ltar mos pa'i yul bdun no //
translated: Thus there are seven objects of the aspiration.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams la mdzes pa dang skal ba dang ldan pa dang / tshig btsan bar yang 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams la mdzes pa dang skal ba dang ldan pa dang / tshig btsan bar yang 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
translated: He becomes beautiful to worldly people, fortunate, and his word is authoritative.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams la mdzes pa ni gang la yod pa de rgyan lta bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams la mdzes pa ni gang la yod pa de rgyan lta bur gyur pa'o //
translated: He becomes beautiful to worldly people, and he becomes like an ornament to those who have him.

original: skal ba dang ldan pa ni dpal chen po'o //
analyzed: skal ba dang ldan pa ni dpal chen po'o //
translated: He becomes fortunate, with great glory.

original: tshig btsan pa ni bden par smra ba la yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: tshig btsan pa ni bden par smra ba la yid ches pa'o //
translated: His word is authoritative, and he is trusted as a speaker of the truth.

original: de ltar mos pa'i yu bcu'o //
analyzed: de ltar mos pa'i yu bcu'o //
translated: This is the tenfold power of aspiration.

original: da ni sems la dbang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sems la dbang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate mastery of mind, he says:

original: gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der yang tshe rabs dran par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der yang tshe rabs dran par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: Wherever he is born, there he remembers his former lives.

original: de la gang dang gang du skyes pa zhes pa ni skye pa'i gnas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang dang gang du skyes pa zhes pa ni skye pa'i gnas bstan pa'o //
translated: There, “wherever he is born” indicates the place of birth.

original: de dang der ni zhes pa ni 'brel pa bsgrub pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de dang der ni zhes pa ni 'brel pa bsgrub pa'i tshig go //
translated: “There” indicates the establishment of the connection.

original: tshe rabs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: tshe rabs zhes pa ni /
translated: “Former lives” means

original: gnas dran pa dang / yul dang / rus dang ming dang / kha zas dang / pha ma dang / tsho'i chad dang / chos la spyod pa dang / gnag nas shi 'phos nas der skyes pa dang / de nas shi 'phos nas gar skyes pa dang /
analyzed: gnas dran pa dang / yul dang / rus dang ming dang / kha zas dang / pha ma dang / tsho'i chad dang / chos la spyod pa dang / gnag nas shi 'phos nas der skyes pa dang / de nas shi 'phos nas gar skyes pa dang /
translated: the place, the country, the family, the name, the food, the parents, the caste, the practice of the Dharma, the place where one died and was reborn there, and the place where one died and was reborn from there.🔽

original: de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa dang / 'di nas shi 'phos nas gang du skye zhing 'dul ba'i skal pa gang yin pa dran pa ste /
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa dang / 'di nas shi 'phos nas gang du skye zhing 'dul ba'i skal pa gang yin pa dran pa ste /
translated: the place, the country, the family, the name, the food, the mother and father, the caste, the practice of the Dharma, the death and transmigration from there, the rebirth there, the death and transmigration from there, the rebirth here, the death and transmigration from here, and the rebirth wherever it is.

original: dran pa bcu ni sems la dbang ba'o //🔽yo byad la dbang ba bstan pa'i phyir longs spyod kyi gzhi che ba dang / 'khor mang ba dang / longs @283a * //
analyzed: dran pa bcu ni sems la dbang ba'o // yo byad la dbang ba bstan pa'i phyir longs spyod kyi gzhi che ba dang / 'khor mang ba dang / longs @283a * //
translated: The ten recollections are the power of mind.

original: spyod mi zad pa dang / 'khor mi zad pa dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: spyod mi zad pa dang / 'khor mi zad pa dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the power over requisites, it is said that they will also possess a great basis of wealth, a large retinue, inexhaustible wealth, and inexhaustible retinue.

original: de la longs spyod ni chos kyi dbyings las yang dag par byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la longs spyod ni chos kyi dbyings las yang dag par byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Wealth is form and so forth that arise from the dharmadhatu.

original: de bas na gzhi che ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzhi che ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a great basis.

original: 'khor mang ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor mang ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The retinue is many, consisting of gods, humans, and so forth.

original: longs spyod mi zad pa ni mthar thug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod mi zad pa ni mthar thug pa med pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment is inexhaustible, without end.

original: 'khor mi zad pa ni 'khor mi phyed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //🔽sems can thams cad kyi mchog dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor mi zad pa ni 'khor mi phyed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // sems can thams cad kyi mchog dang zhes pa ni /
translated: The retinue is inexhaustible because it is endowed with an undivided retinue.🔽One becomes the supreme of all sentient beings.

original: sems can kyang yin la zhes pa ste kun gyi gtso bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems can kyang yin la zhes pa ste kun gyi gtso bor gyur pa'o //
translated: Sentient beings are those who are called “all,” and one becomes the chief of all.

original: yon tan mchog dang yang dag par ldan par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni ;
analyzed: yon tan mchog dang yang dag par ldan par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni ;
translated: One becomes endowed with the supreme qualities.

original: yon tan mchog dang ldan pa ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan mchog dang ldan pa ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Endowed with the supreme qualities means endowed with the qualities of the powers, fearlessnesses, and so forth.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan dang yang dag par ldan par 'gyur ro //🔽rang bzhin gyis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes pa la rang bzhin gyis zhes pa ni rang gi dang gis zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan dang yang dag par ldan par 'gyur ro // rang bzhin gyis kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes pa la rang bzhin gyis zhes pa ni rang gi dang gis zhes pa ste /
translated: One becomes endowed with the supramundane qualities.🔽One becomes endowed with the qualities of the six perfections by nature. By nature means by oneself.

original: ched du ma bsgrubs kyang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ched du ma bsgrubs kyang zhes pa'o //
translated: Even without deliberately practicing, one becomes endowed with the qualities of the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po nyid yo byad du gsungs te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po nyid yo byad du gsungs te /
translated: The six perfections themselves are called equipment.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sbyin pa ni yo byad do zhes pa nas shes rab ni yo byad do zhes pa'i bar gyis yo byad du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni yo byad do zhes pa nas shes rab ni yo byad do zhes pa'i bar gyis yo byad du gsungs pa'o //
translated: Generosity is equipment, up to wisdom is equipment.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi la yang gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i sems can mchog go //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi la yang gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i sems can mchog go //
translated: He will also be established in the four divine abodes, which are the highest divine states.

original: gnas bzhi ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gnas bzhi ni go sla'o //
translated: The four abodes are easy to understand.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin zhes pa yang yo byad do //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin zhes pa yang yo byad do //
translated: Mindfulness and vigilance are also equipment.

original: de ltar mang ba gnyis dang mi zad pa gnyis dang lhag pa bcu ni yo byad la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar mang ba gnyis dang mi zad pa gnyis dang lhag pa bcu ni yo byad la dbang ba'o //
translated: Thus, the two sets of two, the two inexhaustible treasures, and the ten excellences are the mastery of equipment.

original: de nas smon lam la dbang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas smon lam la dbang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to show mastery of vows,

original: thabs dang stobs dang smon lam dang ye shes dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: thabs dang stobs dang smon lam dang ye shes dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: he will possess means, power, vows, and knowledge.

original: de la smon lam ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gzhan gyi don du smon pa tsam gyis 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de la smon lam ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gzhan gyi don du smon pa tsam gyis 'grub pa'o //
translated: Among them, vows are the accomplishment of the ten perfections for the sake of others merely by the aspiration.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: da ni chos la dbang ba bstan pa'i phyir bstan bcos thams cad la yang 'jigs pa med pa dang sma ba la mkhas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni chos la dbang ba bstan pa'i phyir bstan bcos thams cad la yang 'jigs pa med pa dang sma ba la mkhas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate mastery of the Dharma, the text says that one will become fearless with regard to all treatises and skilled in debate.

original: de la bstan bcos ni phyir mi ldog pa'i bstan bcos dang / nang rig pa'i bstan bcos dang / sgra dang tshad mar gyur pa rig pa'i bstan bcos dang / bzo dang sgyu rtsa la rig pa'i bstan bcos dang / gso ba rig pa'i bstan bcos so //
analyzed: de la bstan bcos ni phyir mi ldog pa'i bstan bcos dang / nang rig pa'i bstan bcos dang / sgra dang tshad mar gyur pa rig pa'i bstan bcos dang / bzo dang sgyu rtsa la rig pa'i bstan bcos dang / gso ba rig pa'i bstan bcos so //
translated: Treatises are of five kinds: treatises on non-return, treatises on inner science, treatises on the science of grammar and logic, treatises on the science of craftsmanship and the arts, and treatises on the science of medicine.

original: de rnams la @283b dbang thob pa ni mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la @283b dbang thob pa ni mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: Mastery of these is fearlessness.

original: smra ba la mkhas pa ni gzhan la ngag skyon dang bral bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba la mkhas pa ni gzhan la ngag skyon dang bral bar ston pa'o //
translated: Skill in debate is teaching others free of verbal faults.

original: mi blun pa dang zhes pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pas rgyud sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi blun pa dang zhes pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pas rgyud sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Fools are those whose mindstreams have not been trained by listening, reflection, and meditation on the teachings of the Bhagavan Buddha.

original: tshig gsal ba dang zhes pa ni smra ba'i dus su gzhan gyis nyan par bde ba'o //
analyzed: tshig gsal ba dang zhes pa ni smra ba'i dus su gzhan gyis nyan par bde ba'o //
translated: Clear speech is speech that is pleasant for others to listen to.

original: sgrin por yang 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sems kyis thegs pa ste g-yer ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sgrin por yang 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sems kyis thegs pa ste g-yer ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: And he is not lazy means that he is not lazy in his mind, that is, he is not arrogant.

original: shes nyen can dang zhes pa ni shes par bya ba'i chos thams cad la dbang thos pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: shes nyen can dang zhes pa ni shes par bya ba'i chos thams cad la dbang thos pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: And he is not greedy means that he is not greedy for all the phenomena that are to be known, because he has mastery over them.

original: bstan bcos lnga dang 'og ma lnga ste bcu'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos lnga dang 'og ma lnga ste bcu'o //
translated: The five treatises and the five lower ones make ten.

original: da ni rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba bstan pa'i phyir le lo med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba bstan pa'i phyir le lo med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach mastery over magic power, he says the absence of laziness, etc.

original: de la le lo med pa ni shin tu myur bar 'grol bar byed pa'o /
analyzed: de la le lo med pa ni shin tu myur bar 'grol bar byed pa'o /
translated: There, the absence of laziness is the very swift performance of going.

original: chog shes pa dang zhes pa ni nyung zad kyis tshim par byed pa'o //🔽don che ba dang zhes pa ni cho 'phrul gsum gyis sems can gyi don byed pa'o ;
analyzed: chog shes pa dang zhes pa ni nyung zad kyis tshim par byed pa'o // don che ba dang zhes pa ni cho 'phrul gsum gyis sems can gyi don byed pa'o ;
translated: And he is not greedy means that he is not greedy for a little satisfaction.

original: / sred pa med par yang 'gyur ro zhes pa ni rang gi nus pa la sems kyis gdung ba mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: / sred pa med par yang 'gyur ro zhes pa ni rang gi nus pa la sems kyis gdung ba mi skyed pa'o //
translated: And he is not greedy means that he is not greedy for the benefit of himself, because he is not greedy for his own power.🔽And he is not greedy means that he is not greedy for the benefit of himself, because he is not greedy for his own power.🔽And he is not greedy means that he is not greedy for the benefit of himself, because he is not greedy for his own power.

original: sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu yid brtan pa dang zhes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdu 'phrul gyi sgo nas yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu yid brtan pa dang zhes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdu 'phrul gyi sgo nas yid ches pa'o //
translated: The phrase they will be the most trustworthy of all sentient beings means that they will be trusted by means of supramundane miracles.

original: slob dpon dang zhes pa ni gang gis gus par bya pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: slob dpon dang zhes pa ni gang gis gus par bya pa'i yul lo //
translated: The phrase they will be teachers means that they will be objects of respect.

original: bla mar bkur ba yang 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bkur sti bya ba'i ming gi rnam grangs su gsungs so //
analyzed: bla mar bkur ba yang 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bkur sti bya ba'i ming gi rnam grangs su gsungs so //
translated: The phrase they will be revered means that they will be objects of worship.

original: des sngon ma thos pa'i bzo dang / sgyu rtsa la dang zhes pa ni sems can chen po des snga ma lam bslabs su zin kyang rdzu 'phrul gyi sgyu rtsal drug cu rtsa bzhi la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: des sngon ma thos pa'i bzo dang / sgyu rtsa la dang zhes pa ni sems can chen po des snga ma lam bslabs su zin kyang rdzu 'phrul gyi sgyu rtsal drug cu rtsa bzhi la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis 'byung ngo //
translated: The phrase they will naturally know all the arts and crafts that they have not learned before means that even though those great beings have already learned the path, they will naturally know the sixty-four arts and crafts of miracles, and so on.

original: mngon par shes pa'i shes pa dang zhes pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i shes pa dang zhes pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The phrase they will have the knowledge of the superknowledges has been explained.

original: bstan bcos thams cad kyang don dang yi ge'i sgo nas shes par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos thams cad kyang don dang yi ge'i sgo nas shes par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase they will know the meaning and the words of all the treatises means that

original: bstan bcos thams cad ni don dang yi ge gnyis su 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos thams cad ni don dang yi ge gnyis su 'dus pa'o //
translated: all the treatises are included in the two, meaning and words.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: It is said:🔽The treatises are included in the two, meaning and words.

original: ji ltar mnams na rab dkul  //
analyzed: ji ltar mnams na rab dkul  //
translated: How is it to be tasted?

original: myangs na zhim pa'i sman bzhin du //
analyzed: myangs na zhim pa'i sman bzhin du //
translated: Like medicine that is bitter to the taste but sweet to the stomach.

original: chos kyang rnam pa gnyis su gnas //
analyzed: chos kyang rnam pa gnyis su gnas //
translated: The Dharma also exists in two forms.

original: don dang yi ger shes par bya //
analyzed: don dang yi ger shes par bya //
translated: It should be known as meaning and as letter.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de ltar tshig bcus ni rdzu 'phrul la dbang pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshig bcus ni rdzu 'phrul la dbang pa'o //
translated: In this way, by ten words, there is mastery of magical power.

original: da ni las la dbang pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni las la dbang pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate mastery of action,🔽it is said:

original: tshul khrims dang zhes pa @284a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang zhes pa @284a * //
translated: Morality,

original: gsungs te / tshul khrims ni dge slong la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: gsungs te / tshul khrims ni dge slong la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: Morality is that of the monk and so forth.

original: dang zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dang rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: dang zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dang rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: And means the bodhisattva and the vajra-holder.

original: 'tsho ba dang zhes pa ni gang yod na 'tsho bar 'gyur pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba dang zhes pa ni gang yod na 'tsho bar 'gyur pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Livelihood is so called because one lives by it.

original: kun du spyod pa zhes pa ni thams cad du spyod pa ste lus kyi kun du spyod pa dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa dang yid kyi kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa zhes pa ni thams cad du spyod pa ste lus kyi kun du spyod pa dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa dang yid kyi kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: Conduct is the conduct in all things, the conduct of body, speech, and mind.

original: shin tu yongs su dag par spyod ba dang zhes pa ni khyad par du yang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu yongs su dag par spyod ba dang zhes pa ni khyad par du yang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “With very pure conduct” means “in particular.”

original: yongs su ni yang dag par zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ni yang dag par zhes pa'o //
translated: “Pure” means “correct.”

original: dag pa ni sngar smos pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa gsum dang / de'i rten sgo gsum dang / 'tsho ba dang bdun skyon med par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa ni sngar smos pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa gsum dang / de'i rten sgo gsum dang / 'tsho ba dang bdun skyon med par spyod pa'o //
translated: “Conduct” means the three previously mentioned ones of morality and so on, and the seven of the three doors, livelihood, and so on, which are faultless.

original: legs par rab tu byung ba dang zhes pa ni phyogs gnyis te /
analyzed: legs par rab tu byung ba dang zhes pa ni phyogs gnyis te /
translated: “Well gone forth” has two aspects:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'am /
translated: the Bodhisattva Vehicle

original: yang na rdo rje theg par ro //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje theg par ro //

analyzed: yang zhes pa ni dang zhes pa ste de dang bcu ni las la dbang ba'o //

original: da ni ye shes la dbang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ye shes la dbang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show mastery of wisdom, it says:

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems kyang mi brjed par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: And he does not forget the Thought of Enlightenment which is omniscience.

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku dang / bde ba chen po'i sku'o //
translated: Omniscience is the Dharma Body, the Body of Bliss, the Transformation Body, and the Great Bliss Body.

original: yang na chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi skabs las /
analyzed: yang na chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi skabs las /
translated: Or else, in the context of the gnosis of the Element of Attributes,🔽it is said to be tenfold:

original: sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can //
translated: The Buddha is the embodiment of the five bodies,

original: khyab bdag ye shes lnga yi bdag / ces bcur gsungs so //
analyzed: khyab bdag ye shes lnga yi bdag / ces bcur gsungs so //
translated: the lord of the five gnoses.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ngo bo nyid dang tha mi dad pa yin pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ngo bo nyid dang tha mi dad pa yin pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment is not different from the essence of omniscience, so it is the Thought of Enlightenment which is omniscience.

original: mi brjod pa ni dran pa'i ngo bo nyid de //
analyzed: mi brjod pa ni dran pa'i ngo bo nyid de //
translated: Not forgetting is the essence of memory.

original: sngar bstan pa'i yan lag drug ni man ngag go //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i yan lag drug ni man ngag go //
translated: The six branches taught above are the precepts.

original: legs par rab tu byung ba nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: legs par rab tu byung ba nyid gang zhe na /

original: nyan thos dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi nges pa la nam yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: nyan thos dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi nges pa la nam yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: He will never enter the certainty of a śrāvaka arhat or a pratyekabuddha.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i theg pa ni nam yang sangs rgyas par mi 'gyur zhes pa ste gzhan gyi tshig don ni go @284b sla'o ;
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i theg pa ni nam yang sangs rgyas par mi 'gyur zhes pa ste gzhan gyi tshig don ni go @284b sla'o ;
translated: The vehicle of freedom from attachment will never become a buddha. The meaning of the other words is easy to understand.

original: / da ni sngar bstan pa de la ngag gi don bsdus nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / da ni sngar bstan pa de la ngag gi don bsdus nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the meaning of the words that were previously explained,

original: lag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang de ltar na yon tan dpag tu med pa dag dang ldan par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang de ltar na yon tan dpag tu med pa dag dang ldan par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Vajrapāṇi, the vajra holder, said, “Thus, he will possess immeasurable qualities.”

original: de ltar na zhes pa ni sngar bstan ma thag pa de ltar na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes pa ni sngar bstan ma thag pa de ltar na zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus means just as it was explained immediately before.

original: yon tan ni che ba'i yon tan no //
analyzed: yon tan ni che ba'i yon tan no //
translated: Qualities are great qualities.

original: dpag tu med pa ni grangs dang rtsis kyis mi lang zhing /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa ni grangs dang rtsis kyis mi lang zhing /
translated: Immeasurable means that they cannot be measured by number or calculation.

original: tsam zhes pa'i mtha' las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: tsam zhes pa'i mtha' las 'das pa'o //
translated: Beyond is beyond the mere.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i yon tan gyi tshogs dpag tu med pa gzhan dag dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i yon tan gyi tshogs dpag tu med pa gzhan dag dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
translated: One will also possess other immeasurable collections of good qualities of this kind.

original: chos dang / longs spyod dang / sprul pa'i sku la sogs pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid sngar bshad pa dang / 'dir ma smos pa'i yon tan gzhung gzhan las ji snyed bshad pa de dag kyang 'dir lag na rdo rje khyod kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang / longs spyod dang / sprul pa'i sku la sogs pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid sngar bshad pa dang / 'dir ma smos pa'i yon tan gzhung gzhan las ji snyed bshad pa de dag kyang 'dir lag na rdo rje khyod kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: Vajrapāṇi, you should understand the greatness of the Dharma Body, the Enjoyment Body, the Emanation Body, and so forth, as explained above and the good qualities not mentioned here, as many as they are, as explained in other scriptures.

original: da ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i don gzhung 'di gang dang gang gis 'dzin pa'i gang zag ma 'ongs pa'i dus su lung bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i don gzhung 'di gang dang gang gis 'dzin pa'i gang zag ma 'ongs pa'i dus su lung bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to prophesy the person who will uphold this scripture, the meaning of the Praise in Honor of One Worthy of Honor,

original: lag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje rdo rje 'chang //
translated: it says, “Vajrapāṇi, Vajradhara,”

original: zhes bod pa mdzad nas /
analyzed: zhes bod pa mdzad nas /
translated: and so forth.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di yang dag par 'dzin pa'i skyes bu de ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa 'di yang dag par 'dzin pa'i skyes bu de ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The person who upholds this ultimate Praise in Honor of One Worthy of Honor is as follows.

original: de la don dam pa ni nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la don dam pa ni nges pa'i don to //
translated: Here, the ultimate is the definitive meaning.

original: tshig gi yul las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gi yul las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is beyond the domain of words.

original: mtshan ni bla dags kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ni bla dags kyi ming ngo //
translated: Name is the name of the designation.

original: yang dag par brjod pa ni sgra'i skyon spangs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par brjod pa ni sgra'i skyon spangs pa'o //
translated: Correct expression is the abandonment of faults of speech.

original: 'dir zhes pa ni de ltar bshad ma thag pa 'di zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes pa ni de ltar bshad ma thag pa 'di zhes pa'o //
translated: Here means just as it was explained.

original: yang dag par 'dzin pa ni phyin ci log pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin pa ni phyin ci log pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Correctly holding is holding without error.

original: skyes bu zhes pa ni yon tan gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu zhes pa ni yon tan gang gi phyir ro //
translated: Person is for the sake of the qualities.

original: yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen tshol ba dang / chos nyan pa dang / don sems pa dang / don bzhin du spyod pa dang / chos bzhi dang ldan pa ni skyes bu zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen tshol ba dang / chos nyan pa dang / don sems pa dang / don bzhin du spyod pa dang / chos bzhi dang ldan pa ni skyes bu zhes pa'o //
translated: One who has the four dharmas of seeking the spiritual friend, listening to the dharma, contemplating the meaning, and practicing in accordance with the meaning is a person.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs legs par bsags shing zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs legs par bsags shing zhes pa ni /
translated: Having well accumulated the accumulations of merit and wisdom

analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa nyid bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yin pas na'o //
translated: means that the Praise in Hundred and Fifty Verses itself is the accumulation of merit and wisdom.

original: de yang dag par bzung bas tshogs sog par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dag par bzung bas tshogs sog par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: By correctly holding it, one will accumulate the accumulations.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams shin tu myur bar 'grub nas ring bor mi thogs par zhes pa ste /
translated: The qualities of a Buddha are accomplished very quickly, and it is said that “before long” he will be a Buddha.

original: de la ring por mi thogs pa ni tshe 'di nyid la'o //
analyzed: de la ring por mi thogs pa ni tshe 'di nyid la'o //
translated: “Before long” means in this very life.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //🔽bla na med pa yang dag par @285a * //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o // bla na med pa yang dag par @285a * //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.🔽He will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur te zhes pa ni byang chub de'i bla na gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //

translated: This means that there is nothing higher than that awakening.🔽He will not pass into parinirvāṇa for many eons.

original: bskal pa mang por yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos su mi 'gyur par zhes pa ni bstan ba dang ston pa yang yun ring du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskal pa mang por yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos su mi 'gyur par zhes pa ni bstan ba dang ston pa yang yun ring du gnas par 'gyur ro //

original: ci byed ce na /
analyzed: ci byed ce na /
translated: What will he do?

analyzed: sems can thams cad la bla na med pa'i chos ston pa dang zhes pa ste /
translated: He will teach the unsurpassed Dharma to all sentient beings.

analyzed: bla na med pa'i chos ni rdo rje theg pa'i chos so //
translated: The unsurpassed Dharma is the Dharma of the Vajra Vehicle.

analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that he will turn the wheel of Dharma that is different from that,🔽it says:

analyzed: dam pa'i chos ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
